course_title: Freshman Seminar: The Trojan War & the Travels of Odysseus. "Homer"
class_notes:
The Trojan War and the Travels of Odysseus: the Iliad, the Odyssey, and their Influence.
Helen of Troy, the wrath of Achilles, the weaving of Penelope and the wily Odysseus, fantastic journey past monsters of enticement and menace: the tales of Homer have intrigued and inspired artists and thinkers for centuries. In this course, we will begin by reading the Iliad and Odyssey slowly and carefully with an attention to their details, and we will discuss, with the help of scholars who have studied them, some of the many issues they raise. We will also sample the many works influenced by the Homeric epics, from ancient drama to contemporary novels and film.
Requirements include several short papers, one ten-minute oral report, and contributions to class discussion. There will also be one larger final project in the interpretation of Homer, a longer essay or a creative project, e.g., a series of poems or a video production offering a reinterpretation of some aspect of the two poems.
course_description: Limited to freshmen. Topic changes to reflect changing interests of faculty and students.
